intro: Psychotria mineirensis, commonly known as the Brazilian Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil, where it thrives in humid, tropical climates. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It produces small, fleshy berries that are typically red when mature. Psychotria mineirensis is often found in shaded, understory environments within its native habitat.
